start.speaker: Kade
start.text: Welcome back! Let's discuss what arrays are today.

intro.speaker: Kade
intro.text: Arrays are a nice quick way to store a bunch of data together. This makes it easier to store and retrieve data, instead of relying on a variable for each value.

type.speaker: Kade
type.text: Arrays, however, can only store one type of data. I'll show you how to loop through variables in the next video!

assignment.speaker: Kade
assignment.text: You can initialise arrays using { }, for instance: double[] prices = {13.1, 15.87, 14.22, 16.66};

retrieve.speaker: Kade
retrieve.text: You can also access variables in an array by placing the index in [ ] brackets, like prices[1]. Remember, indices start from 1 here.
